query: CREATE FUNCTION wait_for_hot_stats() RETURNS void AS $$ DECLARE start_time timestamptz := clock_timestamp(); updated bool; BEGIN  FOR i IN 1 .. 300 LOOP SELECT (pg_stat_get_tuples_hot_updated('brin_hot'::regclass::oid) > 0) INTO updated; EXIT WHEN updated;   PERFORM pg_sleep_for('100 milliseconds');  PERFORM pg_stat_clear_snapshot(); END LOOP;  RAISE log 'wait_for_hot_stats delayed % seconds', EXTRACT(epoch FROM clock_timestamp() - start_time); END $$ LANGUAGE plpgsql
expected: CREATE FUNCTION wait_for_hot_stats () RETURNS void AS $$ DECLARE start_time timestamptz := clock_timestamp(); updated bool; BEGIN  FOR i IN 1 .. 300 LOOP SELECT (pg_stat_get_tuples_hot_updated('brin_hot'::regclass::oid) > 0) INTO updated; EXIT WHEN updated;   PERFORM pg_sleep_for('100 milliseconds');  PERFORM pg_stat_clear_snapshot(); END LOOP;  RAISE log 'wait_for_hot_stats delayed % seconds', EXTRACT(epoch FROM clock_timestamp() - start_time); END $$ LANGUAGE plpgsql
